newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Belle slips on dilution concerns.
newsitem.headline: Belle slips on dilution concerns.

text.p: Gaming firm Belle Corp slipped on Tuesday by 4.0 centavos, or 4.76 percent, to 8.00 pesos in heavy early trading as some investors sold their holdings on fears a warrant issue will dilute the stock's valuation, brokers said.
Belle was one of the most actively traded stocks with four million shares traded so far.
"There will be a dilution in its valuation if the warrants would be exercised," Edser Trinidad, an analyst at Peregrine Securities, said.
The Securities and Exchange Commission recently approved the warrant issue, which can be exercised after one year.
Belle chief financial officer Eric Recto, however, said that shareholders should not be concerned because they would get additional shares if they exercise the warrants.
"It's like a stock rights. There should be no dilution ... There are two ways of looking at things," Recto told Reuters.
Belle shareholders are entitled to one warrant for every five shares held. The exercise price was set at 8.50 pesos per share.
The company is set to announce within the week the record date for shareholders to be eligible for the warrants.
Ana Candelaria, analyst at Eastern Securities, said that the company's fundamentals remain solid.
She said the release of first quarter results in the coming weeks should change the market's perception on the company.
